meanings.definition: To brainwash or indoctrinate someone through constant exposure to rain or rainy weather.
meanings.sent1: The villain tried to rainwash the hero by trapping them in a never-ending storm.
meanings.sent2: The cult leader attempted to rainwash his followers into believing his every word.
meanings.sent3: The evil scientist's plan to rainwash the town with his weather machine was foiled by a brave group of kids.
meanings.sent4: The propaganda was so effective that it felt like the entire city was rainwashed into submission.
meanings.sent5: The eerie mist seemed to rainwash all who ventured into it, erasing their memories and beliefs.

meanings.definition: The act of brainwashing or indoctrinating someone through constant exposure to rain or rainy weather.
meanings.sent1: The community was in disbelief at the news of the rainwashed individuals found wandering the streets.
meanings.sent2: The documentary shed light on the dark practice of rainwashing vulnerable minds in remote villages.
meanings.sent3: The comedy sketch about a rainwashed support group had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: The concept of being rainwashed by the elements was a central theme in the novel.
meanings.sent5: The legend spoke of a mystical artifact that could reverse the effects of being rainwashed.
